sub_title: Senior Legal Advisor on Gender, International Development Law Organization
summary:
Rea Abada Chiongson is a recognized expert on gender, rule of law, and development issues with 25 years of experience across countries and regions.  As IDLO’s Senior Legal Advisor - Gender, she spearheads the implementation of IDLO’s Gender Strategy and leads the organization’s policy and programmatic work on gender and the rule of law.  

From 2010-2014, Rea was the Gender and Justice Advisor at the World Bank’s Justice Reform Practice Group, Justice for the Poor Program,  and the World Bank Institute’s Gender, Conflict and Fragility program. Rea also worked as a gender and law expert with various institutions including the Asian Development Bank, UN Women, United Nations Development Program, and Swiss Development Corporation, supporting State institutions in the development and implementation of legal and institutional frameworks on gender equality. 

Rea worked extensively with civil society at global, national and locals levels, including as program officer of the International Women’s Rights Action Watch-Asia Pacific (2002-2005), as Deputy and Acting Secretary-General of the Working Group for an ASEAN Human Rights Mechanism (1996-2001), and a staff lawyer with the Ateneo Human Rights Center (1996 to 2001).

profile_positions.description:
Senior Gender Advisor (September 2015 - present); Gender Specialist (July 2014 - August 2015)
•	Provide technical leadership and coordination on all gender aspects of IDLO’s work, including in legal and institutional reform, access to justice and strengthening legal innovations.
•	Identify opportunities for IDLO to expand its gender and justice programming portfolio. 
•	Develop, guide and support the integration of gender in IDLO’s work, including through the development and implementation of its gender strategy at all levels of the organization.
•	Provide expert/advisory support to IDLO's programs and project at global, regional and country levels, including leading missions to develop IDLO programming.
•	Establish and strengthen strategic partnerships, including with governments, civil society, experts working on gender, law, justice and development. 
•	Champion gender activities within IDLO
profile_positions.title: Senior Legal Advisor - Gender
Leadership Council Member, Global Women’s Institute

profile_positions.description:
• Lead the development and management of a global community of practice composed of development professionals and gender specialists to serve as a gateway for knowledge exchange, networking and capacity building on gender issues, conflict and fragility.
• Develop an e-­‐learning module on gender and fragility for a World Bank course on conflict, security and development. The e-­‐learning module will consist of 6 topics relating to gender in fragile and conflict situations (FCS): (1) overview of gender, fragility, and development; (2) male gender issues; (3) sexual and gender based violence in FCS; (4) women’s access to resources through entrepreneurship; (5) gender and the extractive industries; and (6) women’s participation in peacemaking and conflict resolution.
•Author a policy paper for development practitioners on policy and institutional approaches for addressing justice related aspects of sexual and gender-based violence in situations of conflict and fragility.
•Provide technical support in the development of lesson learned case studies on: (a) women's participation in the negotiation of mining benefits agreement in Papua New Guinea; (b)  women and entrepreneurship in South Sudan and Liberia; (c) assessment of the sexual offenses court in Liberia, among others.
profile_positions.title: Gender and Justice Advisor

profile_positions.description:
•Led the World Bank's Justice Reform Practice Group's (LEGJR) contributions to global and regional dialogue on gender, law, justice and development, including LEGJR’s contributions to the World Development Report 2012 on Gender and Development; the EAP WDR companion piece on gender equality; the Africa flagship gender report, Empowering Women: Legal Rights and Economic Opportunities in Africa; and the UN Women’s Progress of the World’s Women Report 2011-2012, In Pursuit of Justice.
•Provided technical advice on integrating a gender perspective in the analytical and operational work of the Justice for the Poor (J4P) program within the Legal Vice-Presidency. J4P’s thematic focus includes: access to justice, land and natural resource governance, and justice aspects of service delivery particularly in situations of legal pluralism, fragility and conflict, severe intra-group inequities and marginalization.
•Advised and collaborated with J4P country teams in Indonesia, Papua New Guinea, Solomon Islands, Timor-Leste, Vanuatu and Sierra Leone to ensure high quality of concept notes, proposals, research, and other analytical documents and publications, especially with regard to women’s access to justice and legal aid, women’s leadership in local justice institutions, women’s inclusion in service delivery through local and community development projects, and equity in land and natural resource transactions. 
•Prepared briefings for and advise the WBG Senior Vice President and General Counsel on gender, justice and development, with a particular focus on women’s access to justice.
•Resulted in increased visibility and impact of the program and unit, both within the Bank Group and with external partners; inclusion of women’s access to justice in World Development Report 2012 as a priority area of action; and improved incorporation of gender in J4P country work programs.
profile_positions.title: Gender and Justice Advisor

profile_positions.description: •Advised the Ministry of Women’s Empowerment of Indonesia on development of gender equality law with a focus on incorporating gender within thematic areas, including in education, health, employment, governance, family and social development, strengthening gender mainstreaming systems, and ensuring equitable benefit from development.
profile_positions.title: International Consultant

profile_positions.description:
•Provided analytical advice to gender specialists on the combined Taiwanese NGO report on gender equality which included gender assessments on several priority areas (including education, health, violence against women, labor and employment, family and marriage and political participation) using standards under the Convention on the Elimination of all Forms of Discrimination against Women (CEDAW).
•The report was presented to the government in May 2010.
profile_positions.title: International Consultant

profile_positions.location: Cambodia, Indonesia, Timor Leste and Viet Nam
profile_positions.description:
•Led a capacity building and mentoring program in Southeast Asia (primarily Cambodia, Indonesia, Timor Leste and Vietnam) on assessing gender equality in laws, policies and other state interventions. Resulted in justice sector reforms to improve rights and empowerment of women. 
•Authored a comprehensive guidebook for practitioners and researchers on how to conduct a gender assessment of laws and regulations using the international CEDAW framework to facilitate gender-responsive legislative reform in thematic areas, including property and land rights, decision-making, agriculture, education, health, and other fields of development.
•Advised and guided the Cambodian Ministry of Justice on identifying gender, law and development indicators on labor, trafficking and prostitution, domestic violence and family and marriage. Led to new gender-responsive provisions in Cambodian Civil Code and other laws.
•As a technical expert, supervised an Indonesian working group of government agencies, NGOs, and academics drafting a research on and review of family and marriage laws for reform of Indonesia’s Law on Marriage within the context of gender equality, women’s empowerment.
•Advised and trained the (a) Cambodian National Committee on Women of the Ministry of Women's Affairs and inter-ministerial drafting committee, and (b) Indonesian Ministry on Women’s Empowerment and gender focal points, on drafting gender assessments or state reports on women and gender equality to UN CEDAW Committee.
•Provide technical guidance to the Timor-Leste National Parliament on CEDAW on the development of a gender equality law. A draft bill is slated for submission to Parliament in mid-2010.  
•Advised Timor-Leste NGOs on drafting a comprehensive assessment or shadow report on women’s rights and gender and development policies in the country, which was submitted to and welcomed by the UN CEDAW Committee in June 2009.

profile_positions.description:
•Advised and mentored the National Legal Aid Agency (NLAA) of the Vietnam Ministry of Justice and provincial legal aid centers in Vietnam on gender mainstreaming and women’s empowerment, including on formulating gender action plans.
•Developed and led implementation of a capacity building program on gender mainstreaming and women’s empowerment, including incorporating gender into policy and program development, for legal aid officers.
•Collaborated on NLAA effort to incorporate gender into the legal aid system development strategy 2010-2020, legal normative documents, and legal aid forms.
•Authored comprehensive best practice guidelines on mainstreaming gender into legal aid work, with a focus on the incorporating gender in the organization, operation, policies and programs of the National Legal Aid Agency (NLAA) of the Vietnam Ministry of Justice, and 64 provincial legal aid centers
•Resulted in key contribution to justice sector policy on gender mainstreaming, in particular the Ministry of Justice adopted a circular on gender mainstreaming in legal aid work in April 2010 to guide the work of NLAA and 64 provincial legal aid centers on gender equality.

profile_positions.description:
•Designed and led high-level planning workshop for the Philippine Supreme Court Committee on Gender Responsiveness in the Judiciary (CGRJ) to develop the five‐year gender and development plan for the judicial sector.
•Resulted in the adoption of the five-year gender and development plan that focused on the regularization of family courts, gender sensitivity training for all judges, gender review of Supreme Courts issuances, cooperation with stakeholders in the justice sector, incorporation of a gender perspective in welfare and wellness programs of the judiciary, and resource mobilization.
profile_positions.title: Gender and Law Consultant

profile_positions.description:
•Authored a gender-based review of 200 Vietnamese laws and other legal normative documents covering civil, political, economic, social and cultural fields, to serve as an input to the government assessment headed by the Vietnam Ministry of Labor, Invalids and Social Affairs. Used also as an input to the (a) evaluation of the National Strategy for the Advancement of Women till 2010, (b) development of the National Strategy for Gender Equality for 2011-2020 and the National Target Programme of Action on Gender Equality for 2011-2020, (c) preparation of the next comprehensive State report on gender equality to the UN CEDAW Committee in early 2011, and (d) comprehensive amendment and revision of the Labour Code. 
•Designed and lead two 5-day training programs on CEDAW and gender mainstreaming to the deans, professors and lecturers of the Ho Chi Minh National Political and Administrative Academy, an institution that educates almost all public and political officials in the country. This created a reserve of government officials actively supporting CEDAW in Vietnam.
•Resulted in strengthening a community of practice on CEDAW and gender equality implementation
profile_positions.title: International Consultant

profile_positions.description:
•As Team Leader, led implementation of the advisory technical assistance to the government of Vietnam supporting preparation of a multi-sectoral gender equality law 
•Provided technical advice on drafts of the Law on Gender Equality to the inter-ministerial drafting committee
•Supervised the work of ADB national specialists, and managed a panel of international experts to ensure their contributions were relevant and responsive to issues related to the draft law
•Liaised and foster partnerships with experts, government agencies, parliament and its committees, donors, civil society groups, and other stakeholders
•The gender equality law was passed in November 2007. This law is a comprehensive, cross-sector approach to gender equality and development. Resulted in review of other laws to ensure gender sensitivity and responsiveness.
